Race.SpecificTitle: City of Mandeville -- 1% S&U Tax - CC
Race.SummaryText:
City of Mandeville Proposition
(Sales Tax Rededication)

Summary:  Authority to rededicate the proceeds of a 1% sales and use tax authorized at an election held on August 18, 1959 for various purposes.
Race.FullText:
Shall the City of Mandeville, State of Louisiana (the "City") be authorized to rededicate all of the proceeds received by the City from the levy and collection of a 1% sales and use tax authorized at an election held on August 18, 1959 (an estimated $5,000,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) so that such proceeds (after paying the reasonable and necessary costs and expenses of collecting and administering the tax) may be used for any lawful corporate purpose of the City, including, but not limited to, constructing, improving, extending, maintaining and/or operating: playgrounds and recreational facilities, public roads, streets, bridges and crossings, sewerage, garbage disposal, water works, police facilities, beach
improvements, sea walls and extensions, harbor improvements and other public improvements and facilities in the City, title to which shall be in the public?

Race.SpecificTitle: Recreation Dist. No. 4 -- 10 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Recreation District No. 4 Proposition
(Tax Renewal)

Summary:  10 year, 10 mills property tax renewal for constructing, improving, maintaining and operating recreational facilities and programs for the District.
Race.FullText: Shall St. Tammany Parish Recreation District No. 4, State of Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy a special tax of ten (10) mills on all property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $425,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, commencing with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2021, for the purpose of constructing, improving, maintaining and operating recreational facilities and programs for the District?
